actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on July 17, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Grothman moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mrs. McClain asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Friday, July 14, 2023, it adjourn to meet at noon on Monday July 17, 2023 for Morning-Hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 2670.
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 219
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 210

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Houlahan moved to recommit to the Committee on Armed Services.
The House adopted the amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 2670.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Roy amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 217
On agreeing to the Banks amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 218

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to the amendments to H.R. 2670 which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
On agreeing to the Rogers (AL) amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 583, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 30 minutes of debate on the Rogers (AL) amendment en bloc.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Rogers (AL),  comprised of the following amendments printed in House Report 118-142 as en bloc: Nos. 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 26, 29, 36, 37, 38, 39, 42, 43, 44, 53, 54, 60, 65, 67, 68, 70, 71, 72, 73, 74, 75, 76, 77, 78, 79, and 80.
On agreeing to the Davidson amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 583, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Davidson amendment No. 66.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Davidson,  numbered 66 printed in House Report 118-142 to prevent the DOD from purchasing data that would otherwise require a warrant, court order, or subpoena.

At the conclusion of debate on the Roy amendment No. 64, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Smith (WA) demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 583, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Roy amendment No. 64.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Roy,  numbered 64 printed in House Report 118-142 to prohibit the DOD from carrying out the President's Administration climate change executive orders.

At the conclusion of debate on the Banks amendment No. 63, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Strickland demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 583, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Banks amendment No. 63.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Banks,  numbered 63 printed in House Report 118-142 to prohibit any funds authorized in the bill from being used by the military service academies to discriminate on the basis of race or ethnicity in academy admissions or to establish quotas for admission on the basis of race or ethnicity.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2670 â€” "To authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2024 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Dean of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Davidson demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Davidson objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by Dr. Tony Foster, Restoration Worship Center, Greenwood, South Carolina.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
